intro: Rhinostigma parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved rhinostigma, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Rhinostigma parvifolium is often found in open, sunny areas and is adapted to the cool, temperate climate of its native habitat.
